security_audit.summary: Static analysis flagged pattern matches for crypto and external commands. Evaluation confirms these are false positives: crypto findings misidentify RPC documentation; command findings are curl examples in docs, not executing code. All network access is to localhost (127.0.0.1:27125) for the Obsidian plugin, a safe local RPC endpoint.

high_findings.title: False positive: Weak cryptographic algorithm flagged
high_findings.description: Static scanner misidentified RPC documentation examples as cryptographic code. The skill contains no cryptographic operations - only local RPC calls to Obsidian plugin.

low_findings.title: False positive: External command execution
low_findings.description: Static scanner flagged curl examples in documentation as command execution. These are inline documentation examples, not executing code. The skill is a read-only documentation skill with no runtime command execution.

low_findings.title: False positive: Hardcoded URLs and IP addresses
low_findings.description: Static scanner flagged localhost URLs for the Obsidian plugin RPC endpoint. These are safe local network references (127.0.0.1:27125) used by the Obsidian Bases Query plugin. No external network access or security risk.

content.value_statement: Query Obsidian Bases via the Bases Query plugin (RPC). Use when you need to read structured data from Obsidian bases.
actual_capabilities: List all available Obsidian bases in your vault
Query specific views within a base with filtering
Discover base schema to understand available fields
Extract structured data from markdown frontmatter
limitations: Requires Obsidian Bases Query plugin to be installed and running
Only reads data from Obsidian vault, cannot modify or write
Requires local RPC server to be accessible on localhost:27125
Cannot query bases without knowing the correct file path

use_cases.title: Organize Personal Knowledge Base
use_cases.description: Extract and summarize notes from your Obsidian vault using structured frontmatter data. Find all notes with specific tags, statuses, or dates.

use_cases.title: Track Project Tasks
use_cases.description: Query task databases to get status updates, due dates, and assignees. Generate reports on project progress from your markdown task tracker.

use_cases.title: Build Data-Driven Workflows
use_cases.description: Use Obsidian as a lightweight database. Query structured note collections to power automated workflows and data processing pipelines.

best_practices: Check the base schema first to understand available fields before running complex queries
Use specific field names and filters to reduce result sets and improve performance
Iterate on queries gradually, starting broad then narrowing down to get expected results
anti_patterns: Avoid running queries without knowing the base path - always verify the file exists
Do not assume all bases have the same schema - each base may have different fields
Avoid querying without filters when working with large vaults - results may be overwhelming

faq.question: What is the Bases Query plugin?
faq.answer: The Bases Query plugin is an Obsidian plugin that exposes your Obsidian bases via a local RPC API, allowing you to query structured data stored in markdown files.

faq.question: Do I need to install anything to use this skill?
faq.answer: Yes, you must install the Obsidian Bases Query plugin first. Install via BRAT from: https://github.com/ArtemXTech/obsidian-bases-query

faq.question: What is a base in Obsidian?
faq.answer: A base is a collection of markdown files with consistent frontmatter structure. Think of it as a lightweight database where each note is a record with structured fields.

faq.question: Where do I find the base file path?
faq.answer: The base file path is the path to the .base file in your Obsidian vault. You can find it in the Obsidian Bases Query plugin settings or by listing available bases.

faq.question: Is my data sent to external servers?
faq.answer: No, all queries go to localhost (127.0.0.1:27125). Your data stays on your machine and never leaves your local network.

faq.question: Can this skill modify my Obsidian data?
faq.answer: No, this skill is read-only. It can only query and extract data from your Obsidian bases. Any modifications must be done manually in Obsidian.
